Job Title: Sr. Software Engineer - Front End (React/React Native)
Job Description:
We’re looking for thoughtful engineers with an eye and passion for quality to join our team and help Clear Capital grow. At Clear Capital, we foster a culture of innovation and are creating a world-class technology group that is poised for sustainable growth and success. As new and exciting opportunities reveal themselves in the world of Real Estate Valuation, we are primed to deliver the mission critical data that will change the mortgage finance sector for the better.

We are an agile-minded Real Estate Tech company, nimble enough to move quickly and innovate faster than our larger competitors, and mature enough to outperform start-ups. We are building massively scalable solutions at an enterprise level for some of the largest financial companies on the planet. We’re deeply committed to meaningful collaboration and building applications that are beautiful, fast, and delightful. We believe in not just practicing Agile, but truly being agile; there is a difference. We value great thinkers, problem solvers, respectful communication, hard work, collaboration, and the sharing of ideas. We are on a mission of going from good to great and need the best minds to help us get there. Simply put, we need Amplifiers that go well beyond the average engineer’s production.

What does this mean?
We seek to hire those that amplify the work we do by sharing their knowledge and experience with others. There are unprecedented opportunities for disruption in our industry by a technology and data-driven leader like Clear Capital. The industry is literally starving to leap forward into the future and we are at the forefront of modern mobile, web, and machine learning solutions. We are the company that is seizing the moment and doing things others wish they could. By building a world-class engineering organization we are the ones creating new ideas and ways of doing things.
Our stack and tool set
JavaScript (ES6+)
React
React Native
Redux
Node
D3
Git
Greensock
Webpack
BitBucket
Semantic HTML
Jira and Confluence
CSS, SASS, and Styled Components
What we do
Our primary responsibility is simple: create the best possible user experience in our web and mobile applications
We are product and user driven. The problems we’re solving are difficult and we need thinkers that are excited about this challenge and not afraid to ask questions
We are always collaborating with product owners, product managers, designers and our backend Java developers
We work together to explore possible solutions, iterate on our ideas, and then ultimately translate them into production applications
We support our products from ideation to execution with cross-functional teams
We continuously evolve our products and push to advance the industry
We research new technology and design patterns in collaboration with fellow engineers to determine what will benefit us now and into the foreseeable future
Who we are looking for
Seasoned experience. 5+ years of web-based and mobile enterprise software development.
Research and communication. We solve problems. Before that can happen we need to understand the problem and the proposed solution.
Iterate and validate ideas. There are many different ways to solve a problem. There is a huge difference between "It's working" and "It's the right solution". We want the right answer, not just any answer. To achieve this, we research solutions and iterate on them with key members of our team for validation of our ideas.
Quality standards and scalability. We have to be able to deliver on what we come up with. We need to be able to code our solutions following best practices and company standards.
Collaborate and growth mindset. Iterating and being able to come up with a solution makes half of a developer. We need to be able to work through other people's solutions. We need to provide constructive feedback that makes not only our products better, but ultimately our developers better too.
Characteristics we are looking for and value in candidates
You are smart
You also get it wrong but know its ok and don't blame others
You understand the cycles of developer life
You are flexible and open to others' ideas and solutions, not just your own
You are nice, respectful, and awesome to work with
You learn new things at a rapid pace and you enjoy it
You love to collaborate and are open to feedback
Your passion for tech is contagious
You're an amplifier. Others grow when they work with and beside you
We want engineers who think systematically, implement quickly, and innovate eagerly
INDT

Job Description:
We are CONNECTING HEALTH AND WEALTH. Come be part of remarkable.
How you can make a difference
We are looking for a passionate Site Reliability Engineer to join our team in Draper, Utah. Our team is responsible for driving scalable architecture, minimizing risks, providing visibility across a multitude of environments, systems and applications while using lean principles at scale in a fast-paced environment. You'll contribute to the design and documentation of systems, in collaboration with scrum teams, looking for opportunities to automate away waste. You'll work with scrum teams to troubleshoot complicated systems and applications and will partake in an on-call rotation.
What you’ll be doing
Work with teams to design and implement automated code deployment solutions
Work with teams to design and implement automated environment provisioning and container solutions
Work with teams to design and implement application monitoring and alerting solutions to get issues to the right people at the right time
Work with teams to remediate issues that impact the health and performance of our production systems and infrastructure
Work with teams to diagnose and isolate issues at all layers of the stack, whether it be code or infrastructure, during development and in production
Manage build definitions and hardware in support of our Continuous Delivery policies and procedures
What you will need to be successful
Bachelor's degree in CS/Engineering or equivalent experience
2+ years' experience in a DevOps, SRE, or IT Operations position
1+ years' experience writing SQL queries and Stored Procedures
1+ years' experience developing in .NET and C#
Demonstrated interpersonal skills and ability to collaborate with product owners and development teams
Demonstrated ability to context switch while still delivering on commitments
Ability to troubleshoot complex systems and environments
Experience with CI/CD concepts and tooling
Knowledge of full stack monitoring concepts and tooling from code to system resources
Experience with containerization design concepts and tooling
Benefits and perks
Medical, Dental, Vision
401(k) match
Paid Maternity/Paternity leave
Ongoing education
Tuition Assistance
Gym/Fitness Reimbursement
Purple with Purpose (paid volunteer time off)
HSA contribution and match
On site Lunch and Learns
Award winning Wellness Program
Consumer Driven Healthcare (CDH) education
Why work for HealthEquity
HealthEquity has a vision that by 2030 we will make HSAs as wide-spread and popular as retirement accounts. We are passionate about providing a solution that allows American families to connect health and wealth and build health savings for life. Through our innovative technology and superior service delivery, our members gain valuable insights to better save and spend their healthcare dollars.
We firmly believe that our team members drive the success of this company. We hire passionate contributors who enjoy the thrill of pioneering their positions to their full potential. Join us and discover a work experience where the person is valued more than the position, and where are our purple culture drives a remarkable experience.
Our advice to you
HealthEquity is fiercely focused on hiring passionate individuals to contribute to our purple culture. If you speak passion, excellence, service, ambition, fun… we want to speak with you! We believe that your personality is as important as your experience and qualifications so when we do have the opportunity to speak together, be authentic, be genuine, be you! Showcase your experience and your passion.
HealthEquity, Inc. is a proud promoter of equal opportunities for training, compensation, transfer, promotion, and other aspects of employment for all qualified applicants and employees. HealthEquity, Inc. support Equal Employment Opportunities without regard to sex, race, color, religion, national origin, age, disability, sexual orientation or veteran status when hiring – under federal, state and local laws.

Our technology teams gather requirements from customers and channels partners to build the next generation of ATPCO's product suite. In this position you will focus on facilitating the flow of air travel data across the ecosystem, ensuring its consistency by driving and managing its standards. You will have the opportunity to build the next generation of products used by the airline industry, encompassing more than 200 million fares dynamically updated and distributed in near real time.
ATPCO is the data warehouse of airfare pricing information for airlines, global distribution systems (GDS), online travel agents, and other computer reservation systems.  We take pride in enabling the distribution of airfare content through multiple channels, providing smart connections between airlines, distributors, sellers, and flight shoppers. We make this process more efficient by permitting each airline to submit and distribute its information through their systems, delivering a single source of fare-related data.
The Ideal Candidate:
Extensive experience with Java development
Extensive experience with the following is ideal: Multithreading, Spring Boot, REST APIs
Experience with these is beneficial: Maven, Atlassian Tools, OpenShift, Docker, MongoDB, GIT, Jenkins
Excellent analytical and debugging skills
Is passionate about improving products, processes and people
Is challenged by solving problems within complex scalable, distributed systems and high-volume transaction applications
Cares about results and delivering customer value
Wants to make work fun
Enjoys a good code review

ABOUT THE OPPORTUNITY

Wind River Professional Services has been helping clients implement great innovations, increase ROI and reduce time to market for more than 30 years. We have an excellent opportunity for an Embedded Software Engineer to work on cutting edge development projects in Huntsville, AL, on site with an important customer as part of our respected Professional Services team of highly skilled engineers. The position can be a Member of Technical Staff or a Senior Engineer based on your experience.

The ideal candidate will have proven skills in development of embedded software for embedded hardware systems. The job requires solid people skills for interaction with customers and Wind River services project teams. The qualified candidate will be self-driven with relevant embedded software experience that can be applied to a variety of new processor and peripheral devices. The candidate must have sufficient experience with current VxWorks (preferred) or Wind River Linux (second priority) products to provide direct assistance to end-user-customers. Your contributions in the role will play a critical part in our North American Professional Services team helping our customers create mission critical Aerospace & Defense systems.

Responsibilities
Provide direct assistance to customer teams with Design, implementation and validation of embedded software, e.g. Board Support Packages (BSP) for custom and/or COTS embedded hardware systems

US Citizen

Experience using embedded software development environments (e.g. Workbench, Eclipse)
Experience in custom embedded hardware bring up

WHY WIND RIVER?
Wind River believes that some things are so important they simply cannot fail. That is why we exist. Job Description:
***Security Clearance Required: Secret or Eligible for Secret Level Clearance***

Primary Responsibilities:
Apply knowledge of Network systems engineering expertise in support of system integration/installation definition, design and development, verification methods, sustainment, modeling and simulation, test and evaluation, supportability efforts, interoperability requirements across a wide range of hardware and software systems for ship, shore and mobile Unmanned Mission Control Station (UMCS) systems.

Development of work packages to support strategic planning. Work packages include (but are not limited to):
Government Furnished packages (installation Guidance Instructions and Interface Control Documents (ICD)),
UMCS System of Systems (SoS) System Operational Verification Test (SOVT) plan and matrix for shipboard industrial/stage testing,
Shipboard Stage 1-5 Industrial test procedures,
Establish SWAP-C budgets Unmanned Aviation Warfare Center (UAWC) and ancillary equipment,
Subsystem Interface Change Documents (ICD) for interface gaps
Prepare virtual or 3D ship representative spaces for Human Systems Interface (HSI) studies & production planning, and
Trade studies of physical implementation solutions.
Tasks Performed:
Participate in trade studies. This includes organizing the study team, ensuring quality of technical products and developing/delivering associated technical briefs and products.
Perform shipboard surveys and collect data in support of modification.
Work with Government and Industry engineering, product support, manufacturing and program manager personnel, including technical experts from various DoD entities.
Evaluate, define, and develop technical and product support efforts to:
a) UMCS Network systems/subsystem integration/installation requirements and develop specifications and ICDs as applicable including SWAP-C budgets.
b) Requirements into guidance for installation/system integration design, ICDs and installation work packages.
c) Alternative approaches.
d) Network system portions of UMCS SoS SOVT plan and matrix for shipboard industrial/stage testing.
e) Review deliverables to ensure appropriate level of technical rigor.
f) Document Risk, Issues, and Opportunities (RIO) for ship, shore and test transportable.

Education
Bachelor's Degree in Engineering from an A-BET accredited college or university (REQUIRED).
Desired Degree
Master's Degree from an accredited college or university.
Job Experience

JOURNEYMAN (MID): A Journeyman level person within a labor category has 3 to 10 years of experience related to the functional duties for that labor category and a BA/BS degree. A Journeyman level person typically performs all functional duties independently.

SENIOR: A Senior level person within a labor category has over 10 years of experience related to the functional duties for that labor category and a MA/MS degree. A Senior level person typically works on high-visibility or mission critical aspects of a given program and performs all functional duties independently. A Senior level person may oversee the efforts of less senior staff and/or be responsible for the efforts of all staff assigned to a specific job.

Allowable Experience/Education Substitutions: Bachelors Degree plus 4 years additional relevant work experience may be substituted for a Masters Degree.

There are no substitutions for a Bachelor's Degree in Engineering. This is REQUIRED.

Other Desired Experience:
System networking experience with communications/navigation/sensor network integration.
Shipboard networking design, integration, installation, and check-out.
Familiarity with Naval Modernization process in particular Ship Change Document (SCD) and Ship Installation Drawing (SIDS).
Familiarity with Navy Shore installation process.
Familiarity with Mobile Systems.
Familiarity with NAVAIR Engineering processes.
Familiarity with Fiber optic and Ethernet systems/protocols.
Ability to communicate well in team environments.
Good organizational skills.
Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, Project, and PowerPoint.
Other Qualifications

Security Clearance Required: Secret or Eligible for Secret Level Clearance
Estimated Travel: 25%

At Cleverific, we help ecommerce businesses thrive by putting customers first and building insanely good software.

Full stack engineers at Cleverific take responsibility for solving end-to-end technical challenges quickly and effectively. You will work on projects that span technologies, systems, and processes where you will design, test, and ship great code every day that directly impacts our customers.

Cleverific is a small, profitable, and rapidly growing software as a service company where every position is cross-functional. In this role, you will collaborate with every aspect of the business, from infrastructure, design, and operations to support and customer development.

This is a fast-paced, highly collaborative position based in our downtown Santa Barbara office. No remote candidates will be considered.

Responsibilities
Work with a wide range of systems, processes and technologies to own and solve problems from end-to-end
Build new features for internal and external users
Uphold our high engineering standards while remaining pragmatic and bring consistency to codebases and processes you encounter
Collaborate directly with customers and stakeholders to identify, triage, and solve problems
You may be a fit for this role if you:
Enjoy being a generalist working on both the frontend, backend, and anything it takes to solve problems and delight users both internally and externally
Thrive in a collaborative environment involving different stakeholders and subject matter experts
Nurture and embrace differing perspectives to make better decisions
Take pride in working on projects to successful completion involving a wide variety of technologies and systems
Can stitch together many different services and processes together even if you have not worked with them before
Can put yourself in the shoes of your users and be a steward of crafting great experiences
Enjoy working with a diverse group of people with different expertise
Uphold best practices in engineering, security, and design
Enjoying learning, improving your skills every day (whether in the office or on your own time), and are ready to do the best work of your career
✨ Qualifications
Experience with any of: Ruby on Rails, React, Javascript, Typescript
CS degree not required. A strong track record of quality, thoughtful work is best
About Cleverific

What's it like to work in engineering at Cleverific?

Inclusive culture. Our customers come from all backgrounds, from all around the world. We're committed to building an actively inclusive and progressive work environment that makes Cleverific an excellent home for everyone.

Ownership. Engineers are involved early in project planning and own projects from end-to-end. Rather than participate in tedious planning and estimate exercises, you'll learn about the full context of the project and take ownership for ensuring that the work gets done. You'll be expected to take responsibilities for the stated priorities of your projects while keeping in mind the needs of the team beyond your own role.

Focus time. We hate meetings. On most days, our office is just a nice quiet place with minimal interruptions so you can focus on getting your best work done and collaborate with whoever you need to.

Ship first. We ship prototypes as early as possible. We favor working software in any state over status reports and gantt charts.

What's it like to work at Cleverific?

Cleverific is a fully bootstrapped, profitable software company with no plans to take venture capital. This is a deliberate choice that allows us to make decisions in our best interests and our customers’ best interests. We'll never have to worry about fundraising rounds or the whims of a VC-packed board of directors. But this doesn’t mean we’re not ambitious. Our revenue doubled last year and we’re aiming to more than double again this year. You’ll fit right in with us if you want to be part of this kind of growth.

We’re committed generalists, eager learners, conscientious workers, and curators of what’s essential. Our workplace and our benefits are designed to support a sustainable, healthy relationship with your work.

Work-life balance. You'll work no more than 40 hours a week on a regular basis so you'll have time to pursue your other interests and responsibilities outside of work.

Unlimited PTO. We don't have any rules or accruals for how much time you can take per year. You're encouraged take regular vacations after important deadlines to come back refreshed, with new ideas and enthusiasm.

9x9 schedule. We take every other Friday off to take advantage of our lives in beautiful, sunny Santa Barbara. We use these days for personal appointments, sleeping in, wine tasting, long workouts, anything—it's a bonafide day off. Some of us still choose to work on select projects that are otherwise hard to prioritize.

Benefits and Perks
$90k-$120k
Medical insurance
401(k) plan
Unlimited PTO
9x9 schedule
Stock options
Top of the line Macbook Pro configurations, standing desks, any workstation gear you need
How to Apply

Send your resume and cover letter to jobs@cleverific.com. Your cover letter should speak directly to this position and show us why you would be perfect this role with Cleverific and why Cleverific would be a perfect stepping stone in your career. Take time to research our website and LinkedIn and tell us what speaks to you.

We're accepting applications until March 30th, 2020.

Job Title: Sr. Systems Engineer
Location: Wilsonville, OR
Department: Engineering
Job Type: Full-Time

DWFritz

DWFritz Automation has been engineering and building precision automation solutions for over 45 years. In the last 10 years, we have grown our global footprint with employees and clients in the U.S., Asia, and Europe, while diversifying the industries we serve.

What’s our secret to success?
We're the company that can solve the challenges that nobody else can. We do so by hiring incredibly talented employees who innovate through team-work.

Why would you want to work here?
We are a progressive company that continually strives towards being world-class in our practices, cutting-edge with our technology, and empowering with our leadership. We believe in big things, because we believe in our employees who impress us every day with their ideas and their execution.

Our World Headquarters operates from a modern, state-of-the-art facility located in Wilsonville, Oregon. Our employees enjoy standing desks, a recreation room, a fitness room, and a hearty oatmeal breakfast to start each day. Our spacious lunch room is the venue for weekly All Staff meetings and our frequent “Lunch and Learns.”

We also know how to have fun at DWFritz. From ping-pong tournaments and monthly socials to working with our community through our RISE program and paid volunteer day, we know well how to work and play together. We hope you get the chance to visit our building and experience a culture that is unlike any other.

Your Challenge

To lead cross-functional technical teams responsible for the design and performance of complex custom automation equipment from concept through release, manufacturing, customer acceptance, installation and customer follow-up.

Your Responsibilities
Prepare innovative design concepts and/or analysis critical to success of projects through application of modeling techniques to support system requirements, design, analysis, verification and validation activities beginning in the conceptual design phase and continuing throughout development and later life cycle phases.
Coordinate mechanical, electrical, software, controls, and applications engineering disciplines for the execution of custom automation projects to meet the technical requirements.
First responder for customer facing electro-mechanical automation machines, with minimal notice for international travel as needed. Sometimes lasting 3-4 weeks or longer as needed.
Excellent root cause analysis and problem solving with minimal direction and customer interaction.
Self-motivated and pace setter for rapid resolution and customer satisfaction.
Business acumen when it comes to solution based decision making and issue resolution.
Able to lead technical teams of up to 10 technicians and engineers through issue resolution and root cause determination, and maintain customer facing relations and updates as frequently as required.
Provide technical guidance for preventative actions to reduce and eliminate issues that take away from sustaining manufacturing with extremely high machine uptime and process capability.
Create test plans for acceptance testing (i.e. IAT, FAT, and SAT) to optimize and satisfy customer based requirements, while meeting functional and performance requirements.

Your Qualifications
Familiarity and competency with statistical analysis, including a deep knowledge and application of gage R&R and process capability.
Familiarity with cameras, optics, and lighting for challenging vision applications.
Demonstrated track record of success throughout the full project life cycle (definition, development, validation, and manufacturing).
Solidworks and PDM proficiency preferred.
Strong sense of personal accountability and performance orientation.
Strong work ethic, highly results oriented and high tolerance for ambiguity.
Excellent problem solving skills that incorporate data and statistics to determine corrective and preventative actions.
Must be able to work with and lead technical teams through influence rather than position.
Demonstrated customer focus and orientation to creating value for the customer.
Organizationally nimble, able to navigate the customer and internal organizations.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, questioning/listening skills, and presentation skills.
Ability to communicate complex and technical concepts to non-experts.
Willingness to travel internationally up to 20% of time, for durations of 3-4 weeks or as needed, occasionally with little advanced notice. Must possess a valid passport.

Your Education and Experience
Bachelor’s degree Engineering required, advanced degree desirable.
Recent 10+ years engineering experience with 5+ years' experience as a systems engineer in the machine design / automation industry with combination of design, debug, and production support.
Technical expert in at least one of the following disciplines, direct experience with 3+, and working knowledge 5+:
Precision Mechanical Design
Stepper and Servo motor (position encoder) debug and problem resolution
Motion control
Robotics
Conveyance
Algorithm design
EE analog circuit design
EE mixed signal design
EE digital design
Optical systems
Machine vision and vision tools -- Cognex a plus
Metrology
Firmware development
Object Oriented SW development
GAMP 5 or equivalent experience

Equal Opportunity

In accordance with applicable law, the company prohibits discrimination based on race, color, religion, creed, gender, pregnancy or related medical conditions, age, national origin or ancestry, physical or mental disability, sexual orientation, genetic information, uniformed service or any other consideration protected by federal state and local laws. Our commitment to equal opportunity employment applies to all persons involved in our operations and prohibits unlawful discrimination by any employee.

We work hard. We have fun and energetic group that is looking for someone that can contribute to our positive, and collaborative work environment.

Real team player attitude willing to jump in to get the job done-no matter how big or small

We can't do our work without people like you.

Our employees are extraordinary and committed to making a difference. Here's some of the ways we show our appreciation.
Our benefits go beyond the basics. You'll get to choose from diverse benefit offerings for medical, dental and vision.
We care about each other. We enjoy a positive, collaborative work environment. We are hard workers and high performers.

Company Overview


Dematic is a leading supplier of integrated automated technology, software and services to optimize the supply chain. Dematic employs over 7,000 skilled logistics professionals to serve its customers globally, with engineering centers and manufacturing facilities located around the world. Dematic is one brand under the KION Group of companies and has implemented more than 6,000 integrated systems for a customer base that includes small, medium and large companies doing business in a variety of market sectors. Headquartered in Atlanta, Georgia, Dematic is a member of KION Group, a global leader in industrial trucks, related services and supply chain solutions. Across more than 100 countries worldwide, the KION Group designs, builds and supports logistics solutions that optimize material and information flow within factories, warehouses and distribution centers. The company is the largest manufacturer of industrial trucks in Europe, the second-largest producer of forklifts globally and a leading provider of warehouse automation.

The Role

As a software developer you will be working on designing, implementing and integrating components for complex extensions of our WCS/WES/WMS product “Dematic iQ Optimize”. At its foundation it uses a system wide application platform being based on the JEE / EJB standard. The product is used globally both internally and by partner companies in international customer projects.

Inter- Scrum team collaboration in design and support for integration of modules into standard solutions and sub-systems.
Coach and mentor junior software developers.
Roll-out support:

Support Application Engineering project roll out efforts.
Coach implementation efforts based on the application platform.

Excellent problem solving and creative thinking skills.
Technical skills outlined below.

Detail oriented with focus on getting things done.
Avid learner staying on top of emerging technologies.
Ability to have fun!

Java (including JEE), Wildly, Spring, Quarkus.
Solid understanding and experience with Java technologies including Hibernate, JPA, JPQL, Maven, EJBs, and JSP.
Cloud computing and deployment within major cloud providers; Google, AWS, Azure (Plus).

The National Board for Certified Counselors (NBCC) is a not-for-profit, independent certification organization whose primary purposes are to establish and monitor a national certification system, and to identify those counselors who have voluntarily sought and obtained board certification. The organizational mission is to advance counseling as the premier certification body of the profession with a vision of enhancing society worldwide through quality counseling. NBCC and Affiliates is comprised of three organizational affiliates: the National Board for Certified Counselors (NBCC), the Center for Credentialing and Education (CCE), and the NBCC Foundation (NBCC-F).

NBCC and Affiliates has operations and partnerships in 40 countries providing certification, training programs, and public health services through institutes and residencies. Over 66,000 Board Certified Counselors serve the public and advance mental health efforts across the globe. With a portfolio of nine credentials related to professional counseling, mental health, addictions, human services and career development, NBCC and Affiliates seeks to expand the professional capacity of counselors and human service professionals. NBCC is focused specifically on credentialing, certification and quality assurance, while CCE focuses on providing education and training opportunities and leveraging credentials to best serve communities. Additionally, CCE provides organizational management services for associations, boards and other management clients. The NBCC Foundation engages in capacity building, seeking to expand access to mental health services in underserved and never-served communities and increase the accessibility of high quality professional development resources for counselors.

POSITION REQUIREMENTS AND RESPONSIBILITIES

This position provides web development support to NBCC, Inc. and Affiliates by working with our IT team and our clients to achieve our business’ digital media goals. A hands-on professional with an ability to translate our business needs into client-friendly functions that will expand our website’s influence in our industry. The .NET Developer will be responsible for updating our current websites, web applications, and web services.

Following is a summary of the essential functions for this job. Other duties may be performed, both major and minor, which are not mentioned below. Specific activities may change from time to time.
The position requires constant communication with colleagues.
Strong teamwork skills
Be responsible for maintaining, expanding, and scaling our websites
Stay plugged into emerging technologies/industry trends and apply
Communicates with others as directed on behalf of the IT Director
Assist department in estimating client IT proposals
Assists with special projects and events as directed
Create and update website with a high degree of quality
Present and defend designs and key deliverables to peers and executive level stakeholders
Implement and maintain high-quality SEO policies and incorporate them with content produced for the website
Establish and promote coding guidelines, best practices and standards
Collaborate on code reviews to ensure quality of code base
Other duties as assigned
EDUCATION and EXPERIENCE
Bachelor’s Degree preferred in Computer Science or related field
5+ years’ experience in .NET Web Development
5+ years experience with C#, WCF/ Web API services, MSSQL, .NET Core, and ASP.NET
Deep expertise and hands on experience with Web Applications and programming languages such as HTML, CSS, JavaScript, JQuery
Knowledge of relational database systems, Object Oriented Programming and web application development
Ability to work and thrive in a fast-paced environment, learn rapidly and master diverse web technologies and techniques.
Strong organizational skills to juggle multiple tasks within the constraints of timelines and budgets with business acumen
Knowledge of Microsoft Azure Platform • Experience Entity Framework and LINQ
Proficiency developing in Visual Studio
Experience in hosting applications on Microsoft Azure.
Experience with Git Repositories
Knowledge of Agile methodologies
Expertise in managing projects with Azure DevOps

Technical Capacity • Computer Skills

Job Description:
GUI Developer and UX Engineer
Sivananthan Laboratories is on the cutting edge of research and development of intelligent and automatic-decision making sensors and imagers. Constant innovation of its technologies provides state-of-the-art infrared imagers to U.S. defense and commercial customers. Join our dedicated and talented team of innovators in achieving our mission to “protect those who protect us”.
SUMMARY OF ROLE:
This position seeks a software engineer to develop graphical user interfaces for advanced image processing algorithms on desktops and embedded camera systems. This will involve developing beautiful professional-quality multiplatform desktop software for controling scientific instruments, and reading, translating, and interfacing with legacy code. Sometimes it may also involve developing LabView instruments or designing and defining GUI interfaces to be contracted out. Candidates must have significant experience in user interface and user experience design, as well as sufficient general computing and mathematical understanding to work with the back end algorithm implementations developed by researchers. Candidates should be energetic, versatile, and eager to expand and improve their skill set.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES/RESPONSIBILITIES:
Independently manage business-critical user interface development.
Design, develop and maintain high quality GUI software using Qt or other GUI development tools.
Develop and maintain LabView VIs.
Create GUI back-ends to interface with advanced algorithms and scientific instruments.
Read and translate legacy software written in MATLAB, LabView, and C++.
Stay up to date with new technologies and introduce improved methods.
Collaborate with scientists and engineers to create, implement, and maintain large software packages with git-based source code control and documentation.
REQUIREMENTS:
College degree in User Experience Design, or related fields such as Computer Science, or Software Engineering.
Demonstratable experience developing desktop or embedded GUI interfaces.
Strong programming experience with C++/C#, and at least one GUI development tool set, such as VS, Qt, WFP, WinForm, Win32 or GTK+.
Experience with digital design.
Strong written and verbal communication skills, and good documentation habits.

The incumbent is responsible for providing technical and business support for the Plant Operations Department’s efforts to manage the Corporation’s investments at combustion turbine generating plants in a manner which provides safe and reliable generating capacity and competitively-priced energy to its customers and Member systems, and protects, preserves and enhances the value of those investments.

Job Duties:
Serve as the OPC technical expert on combustion turbines and develop options, financial and technical analyses and recommendations for use by the Corporation and its Members. Discuss and negotiate with operating personnel and co-owners to implement favorable technologies.
Provide business, administrative, and technical support for plant managers and other personnel as needed, including planning, budgeting, and performance analysis for the combustion turbine facilities operated and maintained by OPC. Represent the Director at meetings and other functions as required and execute special projects at the Director’s direction.
Establish and maintain a credible, positive and professional presence within the plants by:
Analyzing and resolving maintenance problems to assure continuity and economy of operations.
Engineering and designing modification for existing equipment and for installations of new equipment and systems to improve plant performance.
Managing major overhauls and outages; directing and monitoring the performance of contractors and OPC Associates.
Identifying and ensuring that adequate parts, materials, supplies, tools, and test equipment is on hand and in good condition to perform overhauls and outages.
Establishing, monitoring, maintaining, evaluating, and re-evaluating cost effectiveness of maintenance programs.
Required Qualifications:

Education: Bachelor’s degree in mechanical engineering, engineering technology, or related physical science (preferably BSME or Equivalent). Technical and business knowledge of generating plant operation, performance and economics.

Experience: This position is a Senior Engineer level position. 10+ years minimum engineering or performance management experience in an operating commercial electric power generating plant is required, including planning, budgeting, preventive and predictive maintenance and performance analysis.

Equivalent Experience:

Licenses, Certifications and/or Registrations: Professional Engineering (PE) license preferred and valid driver’s license that meets the insurance requirements under Oglethorpe Power’s Drivers Qualification Program.

Specialized Skills (i.e., computers, software, tools and equipment uses): Creativity; ability to organize and manage time well and to work with autonomy; good interpersonal skills; strong oral and written communication abilities; good technical and business analytical skills; PC fluency. Ability to work directly with Plant Manager and senior plant staff.

Percent of travel involved: 40%

Unusual hours required of this position: The generating plants operate on a 24‑hour basis. At his or her discretion, the incumbent may elect to remain on‑site around‑the‑clock during forced outages, maintenance outages, or other significant events, and to attend plant meetings which occur outside normal office hours. The incumbent is on 24‑hour call in the event of incidents which affect the operation, rating, or reliability of the Corporations' generating assets

Status: Full-time.

Job Title: Mid Level Systems and Project Engineer
Job Description:
Overview


Modern Technology Solutions, Inc. (MTSI) is seeking a Mid-Level Project/Systems Engineer in Huntsville, AL.

Why is MTSI known as a Great Place to Work?
Interesting Work: Our co-workers support some of the most important and critical programs to our national defense and security.
Values: Our first core value is that employees come first. We challenge our co-workers to provide the highest level of support and service, and reward them with some of the best benefits in the industry.
100% Employee Ownership: we have a stake in each other's success, and the success of our customers. It's also nice to know what's going on across the company; we have company wide town-hall meetings three times a year.
Great Benefits:
20 days PTO/year + 10 holidays/year
Flexible schedules
6% 401k match with immediate vesting
Semi-annual bonus eligibility (July and December)
Company funded Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP) - a separate qualified retirement account

Other company funded benefits

Track Record of Success: We have grown every year since our founding in 1993.

Responsibilities


MTSI is seeking a Systems/Project Engineer in direct support to a Government (Missile Defense Agency) program office in Huntsville, AL. This position will apply the appropriate science, technology, and engineering support necessary to ensure capabilities are developed through all phases of the DoD acquisition program framework applying technical and technical management processes to integration of multiple systems ; interacting with program IPTs regarding the proper application of systems engineering processes; and using top-down design and bottom-up product realization.

Analyze and apply system engineering and technical management processes at the component, system or systems-of-systems levels

Utilize engineering skills to validate developer’s system functional design
Plan, conduct, monitor, evaluate and assess engineering activities relating to the design, development, and/or analysis of hardware and software technologies, sub-system components and systems.
Evaluate future operational system requirements, prioritizing system changes into technical roadmaps for spiral upgrades into fielded system(s).
Qualifications


Required Skills:
Motivated self-starter who is able to work both independently and in a collaborative team environment, often with minimal guidance and within rigid timelines.
Good analytic and critical thinking skills and the ability to apply them in a multi-tasking environment where more than one project may require his/her participation at any given time (typically one primary project and one or two ancillary projects).
Outstanding communication skills in conveying complex technical issues and in providing comprehensive written, oral and/or digital products. The candidate must also have outstanding technical writing and presentation development skills.
5+ years of directly related technical engineering experience
Desired Skills:
Familiarity with DoD acquisition/systems engineering processes
MDA experience preferred
Education:
Bachelor degree in Engineering, Physics or Operations Research preferred
Clearance:
Top Secret clearance with in-scope SSBI and current SCI (TS/SCI); experience working on classified and special access programs

Job Title Modem Firmware Test Engineer (QCT San Diego)

Post Date 03/05/2020

Company
Qualcomm Technologies, Inc.

Job Area Engineering - Test

Location California - San Diego

Job Overview QCT's Modem Firmware Test group is responsible for verifying modem device functionality and features as well as characterizing modem performance at the physical layer during various phases of modem development and commercialization. In addition, the Modem FW Test group is responsible for set-up, automation, maintenance, enhancement, and evolution of modem FW test infrastructure and processes.

You will be responsible for integration/verification of physical layer implementations for complex digital modem ASIC products supporting LTE, UMTS (HSPA+) and IS-2000 technologies. Experience in using / programming / script development on various commercial test equipment (R&S, Anritsu, Keysight, Anite, etc) is required for validating the functionality and performance of advance modem features such as Carrier Aggregation, MIMO, and a variety of other proprietary modem capabilities. In addition, experience in developing system level test plans required as well as ability to digest / analyze performance logs and assist with system level debug. 4G / 5G spec knowledge of physical layer / MAC layer / L1 as well as familiarity with carrier certification / IOT process desired.

The specific job charter entails pre/post silicon verification of the modem subsystem, with primary focus on the physical layer modem firmware, hardware, and systems algorithms. You will be working with a multi-disciplinary team (Modem Firmware/Software, FW/SW integration, Modem Systems, Modem HW, RF Software, as well as Modem Systems Test) in the commercialization of QCT modem products. Much of the job focus will be on testing with internal and third party test equipment.

All Qualcomm employees are expected to actively support diversity on their teams, and in the Company.
Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field.
2+ years Systems Test Engineering or related work experience.

Overview:
Ready to work for a successful, rapidly expanding technology company with a start-up feel? Were looking for candidates who embrace new opportunities and bring creativity and inquisitiveness to their love of learning and new technology. If you have the drive and mind-set to excel in software development and are serious about taking your skills to the next level and beyond, we provide the opportunities and the support that set you up to succeed.

Diversity and Inclusion are important to Oxblue. We value the diversity of thought that comes with working with people from varied backgrounds. Our continuous improvement and ability to serve our customers depends on creating a workplace that brings out the best in everyone. Thats why we are committed to continuing to create an atmosphere of positivity, happiness and inclusion.

Our goal is to hire LAMP software engineers with different experiences and backgrounds and bring them into our highly collaborative and innovative team. Our codebase is built on PHP, Javascript and MySQL and utilizes modern technologies such as VueJS, Composer and FlightPHP. The contributions you make to back-end infrastructure and our front-end application will directly impact our ability to onboard new clients, grow market share, and increase reliability. Our organization is built on great ideas and we will always be welcome to hearing yours.

Successful Candidates:
The first 90 days is an acclimation period during which new hires gain understanding of the company, develop core skills, and create strong inter-team communications. You will demonstrate your basic working knowledge of PHP and assist in programming. Youll become familiar with our product offering, code base, and our different departments so that you understand how the development team impacts our products and the company as a whole.

After acclimation, youll continue expanding your programming skills on the LAMP stack by taking ownership of increasingly challenging assignments. You will demonstrate your value to the team by delivering lean code on schedule and by being able to understand, analyze and write complex MySQL queries. Youll also help with design, testing, and QA of both your code and the teams code. Our goal for your first year is to help you become proficient on the full LAMP stack.

Scope of Future Work:
Here are some of the cool projects you and the development team will be working on in 2020:
Enhancing features in our responsive HTML5 application
MySQL query performance tuning on tables with hundreds of millions of rows
CRM and VoIP server call data integration, feature additions, and performance tuning
Working with BA/BI team and a full SDLC to add new features to internal applications
Penetration testing and code security improvement
Improving dashboards, statistics, and UI/UX for insight into OxBlues internal operations
Automated image out-of-focus detection, stuck rotating camera detection, deflickering, and color correction algorithms
Enhancing features in our responsive VueJS application
Advancing our live video streaming and timelapse generation services
Creating scalable APIs and effective integrations
Company Description:
OxBlue is a technology firm empowering the construction industry to improve project delivery and customer communications via webcam solutions. We manufacture and sell webcam products and provide customer data storage, timelapse movie generation, and a web-based management interface for each camera in the field.

Our external focus is on providing exceptional, high-quality products and an unsurpassed level of customer satisfaction. As a workplace, our internal focus is on quality of life and quality of work. OxBlues culture is casual and fun; the IT department is intelligent, skilled and personable.

A fun work environment: casual dress, free snacks, complimentary massages, and great parties
Investment in your professional development with internal promotions, continuing education, and tuition reimbursement

The National Robotics Engineering Center (NREC) at Carnegie Mellon University is seeking applicants for the position of Software Engineer for existing and new projects. Projects you may support range from industrial machine operator assist systems to agricultural productivity tools and beyond to other automation, autonomy, or safety systems. Your day to day work will include: interfacing and programming for custom sensors and hardware, debugging prototypes, and integrating your work and other software modules into complex systems.

Why NREC?
You will have an impact in shaping the robotics revolution, collaborate with and learn from experts, and build your career in a very fast-growing field. As part of our team, you will develop solutions to solve industrial and government challenges, deploy your technology in real-world situations, work side-by-side with elite robotics experts, and develop a variety of cutting-edge technologies.

Have an Impact!
Remove waste from farming = more food
Make industrial processes environmentally friendly
Make hazardous jobs safer
Improve efficiency in industry & manufacturing
Accelerate screening of pharmaceuticals
Take Control of Your Career!
Select the career pathway that interests you
Influence the direction of projects
Supportive of a non-standard schedule

NREC is at the center of the robotics ecosystem in Pittsburgh, PA. With over 60 robotics companies, Pittsburgh has become the robotics capital of the world. Geek Wire calls it Robotics Row; others call it Roboburgh. Join the leader in the most exciting time in robotics!

Join the best robotics R&D group
Join our talented team at NREC, an operating unit within the world-renowned Robotics Institute at Carnegie Mellon University.

NREC has 20 years of experience and is globally renowned for developing and deploying robots into many applications across multiple sectors, such as agriculture, mining, defense, energy, and manufacturing. We strive to provide solutions for real world challenges where automation and robots have greater impact on productivity and improve the safety and comfort of the labor force. Our unique expertise places us at the forefront of unmanned ground vehicle design, autonomy, sensing and perception, machine learning, machine vision, operator assistance, 3D mapping and position estimation. With over 120 robotics professionals, we can solve challenges that no other organization can.

NREC also leads in educational outreach through its Robotics Academy, which builds robotics curricula and software for K-12 and college-level students.

Be Noble. Be a Software Developer at Noble.

Who We're Seeking


As Noble has grown, we’ve continuously sought better ways to effectively meet our growing needs for supporting students as they apply to, matriculate to, persist in, and graduate from college. Over the past few years, we’ve developed nationally recognized tools and approaches for doing so and are recognized as a leader in finding data driven and sophisticated, yet individualized, approaches for supporting our students in becoming the first in their families to graduate from college.

The Software Developer will help us take this work to the next level by expanding existing software tools to be more stable and scalable and by working with practitioners to develop new solutions to unserved needs. While most of this work will help Noble better serve our students and alumni, we also open source our tools to peer networks around the country, expanding the potential impact to tens of thousands of additional students like ours. The position reports to the Chief Data and Innovation Officer.

Role Responsibilities
Build automation flows and data pipelines to enable a powerful cloud-based data infrastructure.
Create API service endpoints to power the creation of new tools and apps driven by access to student, alumni, and operational data.
Help design and implement a web-based platform that can provide a robust means to collect, store, analyze and report our academic data to Noble leadership and other campus stakeholders.
Maintain and improve a number of existing software tools, with an emphasis on testing, documenting, and refactoring projects to improve stability, scalability and durability.
Help develop and mature the software team’s SDLC and development practices.
Work with the software development team to help create and maintain processes around continuous integration and deployment.
Candidate Qualifications
A mission-driven commitment to making a difference in the lives of underserved students as they attempt to graduate from college.
A bachelor’s degree and 1-3 years of experience working in a high functioning, fast-paced organization in a software development role.
Experience with OOP, ideally with some of that experience in Python.
Experience with some web development including at least one MVC framework.
Knowledge of some front-end development, including some JS-based framework such as Angular or Vue.
Comfortable with SQL and relational databases.
Comfort using the Linux shell and some basic system administration.
Experience being a part of an agile development process.
A belief in test-driven development, peer code review, and a robust CI/CD process.
A history of aggressively delivering measurable results and strong self-management and excellent communication skills.

insurance, 401k contributions, and vacation/sick leave.

True Digital Surgery is a World Leader in Computer-Guided Microsurgery. True Digital Surgery’s (TDS) mission is to continuously innovate in the digital imaging and medical device domains. Our technological pillars include all aspects of hardware and software imaging, robotics, augmented reality (AR) and artificial intelligence (AI). TDS’s products are designed to present the surgeons with real-time image fusions of live, preoperative, interoperative, and aggerated data in order to seamlessly give surgeons with all available information, thereby improving decision quality, and thus patient outcomes. Lead all technical aspects related to the POC/Prototype of: capturing of extended digital data, real time diagnostics, and digital system usage patterns (Black Box & Phone Home).

*Description**
Pearson Education has an immediate need for a Cloud Focused Systems Engineer to join our Infrastructure and Operations (I&O) Monitoring Engineering team.

Monitoring Engineering is a Service Team within I&Os Cloud Foundations Org, providing shared services to our internal customers. As a Service Team, Monitoring Engineering has total stack ownership of several enabling services leveraged across Pearsons Engineering teams, and Pearson Business Units. Cloud Engineers on the I&O Monitoring Engineering team architect, implement, and support Highly Available technology enabling solutions leveraged across Pearsons Educational Development landscape.

As a Monitoring Focused Cloud Engineer, you would be responsible for creating best of breed solutions within Pearsons vast cloud estate. Monitoring Engineering has ownership of several products: Open Source tools such as Grafana, Prometheus, and the ELK stack, self hosted vendor products, SAAS products such as Splunk and PagerDuty, all the way to custom products developed in house. Beyond developing, implementing, and supporting solutions on our current products, monitoring team members are key contributors during cloud implementations. We consult across peer teams to identify which monitoring tools will work best for their products, and evangelize the Cloud Foundations Monitoring Engineering Service Catalog.

Culturally, our team is a close knit group of Cloud Engineers. We meet frequently, we mentor and challenge each other, and we collaborate across projects. We know it takes the full band to put on a concert.
*Qualifications**
Qualifications

+ Real world experience working with public cloud providers and their services

+ AWS Preferred: EC2, ECS, S3, Lambda (Boto3, Step Functions), DynamoDB, IAM, etc

+ Scripting experience: Python, Bash, Powershell, etc

+ Solid understanding of IT Methodologies: Agile/Scrum, CI/CD, ITIL, Change Management

+ Demonstrates Software Development Best Practices: Source Control (git), peer reviewing, etc.

+ Must be a team oriented, highly motivated self starter, who adapts well to change.

+ Strong written and verbal communication skills.

+ Must be able to communicate timely, and effectively, with leadership, team members, and peer teams.

+ Proven experience working on cross team projects which have defined outcomes and deadlines.

Desirables

+ Experience using Prometheus

+ System configuration: Exporters, Alerts, PromQL

+ Writing custom exporters

+ Time Series Database management experience (Graphite, InfluxDB, Prometheus TSDB)

+ Experience managing and leveraging enterprise logging solutions

+ Splunk/Splunk Cloud

+ ELK Stack

+ Loggly

+ Experience using Infrastructure as Code systems such as Terraform and CloudFormation

+ Web development experience is a plus (Javascript proficient)

+ Industry Certifications: AWS (Architect Associate or higher)

+ Not certified? We can help you achieve this goal.

+ CAN DO mindset.

+ Ability to empathize and identify opportunities for continuous improvement.

Why Pearson

Our employees are our greatest asset. As a digital education company, Always Learning is a way of life for our workforce. Along with a great benefit and compensation package, Pearson I&O factors professional development into our Engineering positions. We know that when our team members grow, our organization is able to develop robust solutions which improve lifelong learning for our customers.

Apply today to learn more about the position, our culture, and how you can be a part of the future of education.

Job Description:
PayJunction is seeking a site reliability engineer to support the infrastructure and services that make PayJunction the leading developer of paperless payment software. As a valued member of our small but mighty engineering team, you will ensure our systems are healthy, automated and secure. Our site reliability engineer will help design, build, maintain and enhance our Level 1 PCI security standard. This position is key to our long-term growth, and this person will work closely with our founders.
The site reliability engineer will learn our unique stack, identify areas for improvement, bring a big picture vision, make recommendations and implement solutions. The ideal candidate for this role eats, breathes and sleeps automation, always has security in mind, and can implement best practices to further our mission. Formal education in computer science or related field allows the site reliability engineer to apply coding principles and best practices to PayJunction's systems, infrastructure and automation initiatives, embodying an 'infrastructure as code' approach. We are looking for a Puppet expert to take our automation initiatives to the next level. We take testing seriously, and believe in an effective and efficient engineering approach that reduces bugs and stress.
This is a full-time, in house position at our Minneapolis, MN office.
Areas of Focus
Reliability
Monitoring - site reliability and health
Alerting - critical problems and errors
Metrics - gathering data for troubleshooting of all kinds
Development
Deploying new tools to support our systems and services in an automated fashion
Hardening our systems where applicable
Supporting the deployment of new product services
Basic Knowledge:
Server Administration Tools:
Linux administration
systemd
Bash
LDAP
Apache
SNMP
Nagios
Splunk
Prometheus
Pagerduty
Package management
RAID Configurations
Backup strategies
Scripting / Coding / Development:
Bash
Puppet
Ansible
(use of git)
Testing:
ReSpec
Server spec
Beaker
Vagrant
Coding (experience coding in at least one of the following languages):
Python
Ruby
Java
Ideal candidates will have the following experience and traits:
Outstanding Puppet and Ansible skills and a fundamental desire to automate everything
Comfortable using monitoring and alerting tools like Splunk, Nagios, and Prometheus
Background in programming and strong coding skills (i.e. desire and ability to write quality code)
Direct experience maintaining PCI Compliance
Good understanding of how network fundamentals (packet captures and tracing are a plus)
Ability to triage
Strong coding skills
Security-minded outlook
Strong sense of responsibility and ownership
About PayJunction
Founded in 2000 by three UCSB graduates, PayJunction has grown from a bootstrapped startup to a recognized and respected leader in the payments industry. PayJunction processes more than $5 billion dollars annually for tens of thousands of small and medium businesses with solutions that make it easy to accept credit and debit card payments in-store, online and on-the-go.
Our focus on computer science as an art—combined with our ethical, customer-centric attitude—drives us to develop disruptive technology that lowers costs, simplifies accounting and boosts productivity for small and medium sized businesses. Our cloud-powered payment solution easily and securely integrates with industry-leading business software and management platforms. We take pride in delivering innovative features such as eco-friendly digital signatures and receipts that eliminate the hassles and costs of paper by storing all transactions in the cloud.
Our people-first culture values long-term relationships over short-term profits. Honesty and integrity are part of every interaction with partners, customers and employees. We foster a collaborative work environment, where creative ideas are welcomed, teams are inspired, and success is celebrated. PayJunction is a place where you can find experienced mentors and supportive friends who are committed to your growth.

We create products that improve the lives of our customers.
We build green technology that costs less than our prospective clients pay now.
We are constantly innovating.

Secure our Nation, Ignite your Future

The mission of Marine Corps Systems Command is to serve as the Department of the Navy's (DON) systems command for Marine Corps ground weapon and information technology system programs in order to equip and sustain Marine forces with full-spectrum, current and future expeditionary and crisis response capabilities.

This effort is in support of Program Manager Intelligence Systems (PMIS) in research and development, acquisition, and sustainment of cutting edge tactical intelligence collection, processing and dissemination equipment as well as ground electronic warfare (EW) systems. The purpose of this program is to support PMIS in conducting research, engineering, science, technology, development, advisory, integration, in order to provide enhanced integrated and interoperable intelligence capabilities to the operating forces.

Duties:
Provide technical expertise in research and development, acquisition and sustainment of innovative tactical intelligence collection, processing, and dissemination equipment as well as ground electronic warfare systems.
Develop and update engineering documentation such as System Engineering Plans, Technical Review Action Plans, and Interface Control Documents.
Provide subject matter expertise in acquisition engineering best practices.
Interface with the Program Office to manage engineering tasking.
Analyze technical problems; develop courses of action and present recommendations to leadership on solutions.
Support the execution of System Engineering Technical Reviews through documentation preparation, review of criteria, and preparation of briefing material.
Support the Engineering Change Proposal process by reviewing proposals, advising the Program Office on their technical merit, and presenting to leadership
Position Requirements:
A minimum of six (6) years (with a Bachelor's Degree) relevant software/ systems experience. This experience must show increasing responsibility in development or maintenance of software and/or information networks.
Candidate must have at least two (2) years of experience with at least three (3) of the following:
Requirements definition
Modular testing
Formulating Design Methodology
Documentation origination
Systems Integration and Testing to verify required performance
Assessment of change proposals for technical merit
Database design and development
Three (3) years of experience is required with either Capability Maturity Model integration (CMMI), ISO 9000 or other similar processes and procedures.
Requires Bachelors degree (in Engineering, Computer Science or related field) or equivalent, and five to seven years of related work experience.
Certified Scrum Master
8570 IAT Level II Certification
Additionally, formal training and/or experience with geography or GIS is preferred

Why Smarsh?
Our motto is ‘People First. Inspire Confidence. Embrace the Impossible.’ We hire lifelong learners who have a passion for their discipline and a track record of excellence. To learn more about us, visit www.smarsh.com In our space, Gartner has placed us a leader for 4 consecutive years. Smarsh is the leader in communications compliance, archiving, and analytics. We provide compliance across the broadest set of communications channels with insights on what’s being captured. Smarsh customers manage over 500 million daily conversations across 80 channels and growing. Customers include the top 10 U.S., top 8 European, top 5 Canadian, and top 3 Asian banks. The Smarsh advantage is customers stay ahead of compliance and uncover patterns and relationships hidden within their data.
At Smarsh, we’ve been helping our customers manage new forms of communication since 2001. At Torc, we have always believed that autonomous vehicle technology will transform how we travel, ship goods, and do business.

A leader in autonomous driving since 2007, Torc has spent over a decade commercializing their autonomous solutions with experienced partners. Now a part of the Daimler family, we are developing automated trucks to transform transportation.

Join us and take your career to new heights with a company that helped pioneer autonomous technology. You'll work with an experienced team of people who are committed to creating safer roads, and your contributions will have an impact on the future of transportation.

About the Role:

We're looking for software engineering professionals with expert-level skills in developing software written in modern C++. As a developer, you will work closely with a passionate team of engineers to advance the development of high-quality safety-critical software for self-driving vehicles.

As a software engineer on the Infrastructure & Tools team you will:
Design, build, test and maintain cross-platform C++ applications and libraries for self-driving vehicles.
Collaborate with teams specializing in perception, planning, control, mapping and vehicle testing to develop libraries and applications that support their development efforts.
Work on an agile development team in a fast-paced environment.

Summary

This is a hands-on working leadership role responsible for supporting the customer on all automation related topics as well as supervising the day-to-day operations of the TGW resident maintenance team. The Resident Maintenance Engineer Lead acts as a key liaison and escalation point for the customer on all automation and TGW personnel related topics. A strong overall knowledge of electrical, mechanical, controls automation and software support, with the ability to provide technical support to the customer, are key skill sets for this role.

Job Functions & Responsibilities

Serve as liaison between the supported facility and the Lifetime Services team, building a strong relationship with the customer site team.
Provide broad based electrical, mechanical, FM and software technical ability to improve the site’s performance.
Work with customer on coordinated maintenance activities, planned repairs, and reactive repairs of the automated equipment.
Drive and build upon continuous improvement through team and documentation.
Ensure the team is trained and kept up to date on safety guidelines.
Work with customer to monitor and maintain the site spare parts inventory upon request.

Qualifications

Bachelors degree in engineering or equivalent experience.
Previous experience supervising a maintenance team in a factory or warehouse environment preferred.
Several years experience PLC programming and use of programming, diagnostic and troubleshooting tools (Allen Bradley, Siemens, Rockwell, Beckhoff).
Several years electro mechanical troubleshooting and repair experience with material handing conveyor, AS/RS and shuttle experience; fluent in use of troubleshooting tools (Digital Multimeter, power supply, and hand tools).
Profibus, Profinet, CAN bus experience preferred.
Proficiency with interpreting CAD schematics for use in diagnostics preferred.
Proficiency with MS Office Suite and ERP applications.
Approximately 10% travel may be required.
Qualifications

PRIMARY FUNCTION


The nature of the work of the Senior Controls Engineer is predominantly intellectual and varied in character. Performance of duties in this position requires knowledge of an advanced type in a field of science or learning customarily acquired by a prolonged course of specialized intellectual instruction and study. Performance of the work requires consistent exercise of discretion and judgment to design and develop equipment controls hardware and software in conformance to customer specifications employing standard design practices, applicable codes and assessment of functional requirements. The incumbent closely monitors the progress of the equipment from concept through equipment acceptance on the customer’s floor. The Senior Controls Engineer designs and drafts systems of electrical, hydraulic, and pneumatic controls for equipment, such as arc welders, robots, conveyors, and programmable controllers, applying knowledge of electricity, electronics, hydraulics, and pneumatics. The Senior Controls Engineer typically leads a team of controls engineers, designers and detailers to design and develop equipment controls hardware and software.

Your Role
Meet with Mechanical Engineers, Project Engineers, customer and DT Engineering management to discuss the design and function of the customer equipment.
Work with Project Engineer, estimating and sales to determine the specifications for the job, the estimated hours and schedule, and the specific materials required. Formulates a projected manpower requirement and works with the Engineering Lead-Controls to allocate the necessary manpower for the project. Maintains the schedule and estimate for the project and reports progress.
Design control architecture based on customer specifications, information gathered from the Mechanical Engineers, Project Engineer, and information available from documentation files of similar equipment design.
Oversee the layout of the design and checks for conformance to customer requirements, DT Engineering design standards, National Electrical Code and other appropriate specifications.
Coordinate the design of the control system, consisting of drawings detailing power distribution, Inputs/Outputs, wiring diagrams, cable and panel layouts, and PLC’s.
Submit completed design documentation to customer for approval or modification.
Responsible for all software development created on projects. Must possess and maintain the ability to develop and debug PC/PLC/HMI/SCADA software programming to meet DT Engineering and customer specifications.
Observe the performance of the equipment in simulated or actual operation to evaluate the performance of the software.
Conduct an internal review of the equipment performance with the Project Engineer, Project Team Leads, and quality control to determine/abate any functional problems related to the controls.
Meet with customers on site and reviews the equipment.
Observe equipment with the customer during run-off (production test) to ensure that the equipment meets requirements (safety, performance, customer specs).
Review the equipment construction status with the Project Team Lead. Answers questions from the Operations Group relating to panel layout, push-button and switch locations, conduit routings, etc.
Participate in final equipment performance review.
Mentor, train, coach and develop controls engineers.
QUALIFICATIONS
You have a BS Degree in Electrical Engineering with a minimum of 7 years’ experience in design, development, programming and commissioning custom automated equipment in an OEM environment.
You have extensive experience programming the latest Allen Bradley/Rockwell and Siemens PLC/HMI software.
You have multi-axis servo (CIP) programming experience. Ability to tune and set parameters on most servos.
You have Control Logix Rockwell and motion control experience.

Your Characteristics
Guiding Principles: Alignment and support of each of the (7) guiding principles by your demonstrated actions on a personal, team, and leadership basis; Does not hesitate to address all actions in conflict with these principles.
Cultural Leadership: Has personal characteristics that others choose to emulate; Creates non-linear results and expects this of his/her subordinates and/or team members; Effectively addresses introspect and adjusts accordingly.
Environment & Culture. Established as a change agent from a motivating perspective and achieves noticeable results; a “no quitter, can do” attitude.
Customer Attraction. Demonstrates unwavering approach in harmonizing commitments and plans with the starting point being the end-goal; excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Current & Future Positioning. Achieves deep and nuanced insight into the future; directs forward looking generational solutions.
Financial Leverage. Protects the model without help from the economy; has an in-depth grasp of operating the company with sound fiscal principles and ownership mentality.
Desert Island Credibility. demonstrates consistent success under all conditions.
Education/Experience: sufficiently educated and/or experienced in your area(s) of expertise to operate at a world class level

At DT Engineering, we believe in innovative execution from start to finish as we bring concepts to life. DT Engineering embraces its vision of being the “preeminent, top-tier automation and tooling company within its markets of choice” through the principle of perpetual motion; constantly changing and ever evolving. We pride ourselves in providing the most advanced and creative engineering solutions you’ll find in the industry.

About Twitch


Launched in 2011, Twitch is a global community that comes together each day to create multiplayer entertainment: unique, live, unpredictable experiences created by the interactions of millions. We bring the joy of co-op to everything, from casual gaming to world-class esports to anime marathons, music, and art streams. Twitch also hosts TwitchCon, where we bring everyone together to celebrate, learn, and grow their personal interests and passions. We're always live at Twitch. Stay up to date on all things Twitch on Linkedin, Twitter and on our Blog.

About the Position

Twitch is building the future of interactive entertainment. As a Software Engineer on the Notifications team, you'll work as part of a team of talented engineers to build the system that connects our creators with hundreds of millions of Twitch viewers both on-site and off-site through email, mobile push, and browser notifications channels. We're looking for interest and experience in server-side programming (web architecture, SOA, database architecture) and passion for building clean, scalable, and well-tested systems using Golang and AWS.

Twitch is uniquely positioned to dictate the future of multiplayer entertainment. If this future excites you, come join us!
